chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Caitlyn L. Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 2 days credit IF revoked.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not be in the presence of anyone consuming alcohol. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 7/18/22 by 6:00 p.m.

10:40 AM Defendant Caitlyn L. Lawrence in court. Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Caitlyn L. Lawrence. Court reviews charges and penalties; Court reviews plea agreement; as to count #1 def enters a plea of no contest; Court accepts plea, finds def guilty, and enters judgment; count #2 is DRI; sentencing arguments given; victim rights compliance has been met-there is no restitution request; def makes statement.

Court imposes the following sentence:
Sentence withheld (2 days sentence credit given)
Probation for 3 years with the following conditions:
120 days jail w/ h&t --to commence on 7-18
Lifetime license revocation
AODA assessment and follow through
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not to be on premises of any bar, tavern, liquor stores
Not to be in the presence of any person consuming alcohol
Not to operate vehicle without valid WI operators license
Operating privilege revoked for 24 months - IID
$600 fine + costs + driver improvement surcharge
$26 blood draw fee
Court costs
DNA + costs
BAC  of .148
Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.
